sinks.name: TEE_AsymmetricEncrypt
sinks.reason: Destination buffer may point to shared memory readable by Normal World, causing data exposure

sinks.name: TEE_AsymmetricEncrypt
sinks.reason: Output length pointer is written by the function; if it points to shared memory, it can disclose size/metadata to Normal World

sinks.name: TEE_AsymmetricEncrypt
sinks.reason: Input length can be attacker-controlled; while typically validated by the TEE, passing tainted sizes can cause logic errors or unintended behavior

sinks.name: TEE_GetObjectInfo1
sinks.reason: Writes TEE_ObjectInfo to caller-provided buffer; if this buffer is shared with the Normal World, it can leak metadata.
